intro: Ilex carpinterae, commonly known as the Carpintera holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ilex carpinterae thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
